p: In GMAW, a determining factor for the energy input, the process stability and the formation of the arc is the free wire length l FW , respectively electrical stickout, which is defined as the distance between the contacting point of the fed wire with the contact tip and the attaching point of the arc on the wire [ 23, 24]. Due to an altering arc length, especially in the short arc welding regime, the electrical stickout is difficult to determine. Therefore, the definition of the contact tube to work piece distance (CTWD) has become established [ 25, 26, 27]. In Figure 1a the definition of CTWD and electrical stickout is shown schematically.
